At-a-Glance: Treat hive data like food data: clean inputs, clear ownership, and minimal personal info. Build small, reliable pipelines.
Why it Matters: Messy telemetry wastes time and misleads decisions.
Privacy and trust matter for sites and partners.
Objectives: Document data sources, owners, and retention.
Automate tiny—alert only what you act on.
What Good Looks Like: One CSV/app of record; backups; versioned dashboards.
Simple alert rules with on/off times.
Access limited; keys rotated; sites anonymised.
Step-by-Step: 1) Map sensors and data paths; assign owners.
2) Validate ranges; drop junk; fill gaps visibly.
3) Build small alerts; test; log actions.
Seasonality & Climate: Battery and temp cause gaps—design tolerance.
Diagnostics & Decision Tree: Alert fatigue -> Raise thresholds; silence when on site.
Data drift -> Recalibrate sensors; note firmware changes.
Privacy risk -> Remove precise coords; aggregate.
Common Pitfalls: Public dashboards with exact hive locations.
Tools & Techniques: CSV + cron, lightweight DB, or sheets; secrets manager.
Unit tests for transforms; health pings.
Safety & Compliance: Data protection basics; minimal personal/site data.
Incident logs for outages and breaches.
Communications: Explain to partners what you collect and why.
Notes: Delete more than you hoard—signal beats storage.
